intro: Congea chinensis var. latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract congea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments in forest understories.
